column2: 2) See comments (in black) in this column where provided for context help and information on any abbreviations
3) The ID column is for use in the game code, but please refer to the full ID when requesting further info about any lines of text.

4) Please use Capital letters, punctuation and line spaces in equivalent places to the English text, with particular note to where full-stops are used and where they are omitted. Avoid adding trailing spaces, and spaces on blank lines.
5) Please use the informal form of address (eg. French - "tu").
6) Do no translate \n or %s or $(NUMBER) or $(TEXT), but please retain them in an equivalent position in the translated text.
7) Where words have been abbreviated in English please try to use abbreviations or shorter forms in other languages if possible

8) Where the length of the words is an issue (with screen titles for instance) please provide any appropriate abbreviations usable to replace certain words for that locale if we have issues with space on layouts
9) Please note there are duplicate messages present
1) All comments in red are for the dev team. Ideally these will be removed before sending for translation.
2) _DS and _PC suffixes on ID tags indicate platform-specific text.
3) 'TO DO:' text is still to be written but can be displayed as is for now, to correct placement in game, etc.
The language name, written in that language

column3: Hello this is a script message $(TEXT)
This message has been displayed $(NUMBER) times

column2: $(BLA) doesn't have to be TEXT or NUMBER - just needs to be descriptive for code use i.e.

column2: board' refers to the board of directors of the club

column3: %s, %s's loan period at %s is complete. Are you willing to extend it a further 4 weeks?
The board will be disappointed if we fail to qualify for Europe this season.
Our objective for the forthcoming season should be to be in mid table or higher when the season is completed.
If we could qualify for the playoffs this season then the board will feel we have achieved our objectives.
The board feel that promotion is a realistic target for this season and hope that you will do all you can to achieve this.
The board believe that we have a squad capable of  challenging for the League title this season. We hope you will be able to bring the club the success it deserves.
The board will be disappointed if we are relegated this season.
The %s directors are delighted that you have accepted their offer and look forward to many successful seasons with you at the helm.
Are you sure you wish to repay your loan in full?
Are you sure you wish to repay %s?

The board are bitterly disappointed at being knocked out of the %s so early and feel the club should have achieved much more.
The board are unhappy the club didn't progress further in the %s and hope things will be better next season.
The board congratulate you and your staff on a good Cup run in the %s.
The board congratulate you on reaching the final. It has been an excellent performance in the %s and a real boost to the club.
Whilst it's disappointing to be out of the cup, we can take consolation in the fact that they were from a higher division and were expected to win.
We really should not have been knocked out of the cup at this stage, on our day we should have eased past them.

%s, your contract with %s has expired. After lengthy debate the board have decided not to offer you a new one. They wish you well in the future and thank you for your time at the club.
Your request for a loan of %s has been accepted! The interest rate is %d%%%%, and repayments are set at %s per week for %d years. Do you wish to continue with your request?

The board of Directors feel you have enough players in your squad.
%s, we have the worst disciplinary record in the division. You must sort this out as a matter of urgency.
%s, the board strongly advise you to calm things down on the pitch, or suspensions will become commonplace.
%s, the chairman, in association with the league headquarters, urges you to take measures to improve the clubs poor disciplinary record.

The board wish to express their concern over the lack of a coach and suggest you to employ one soon.

%s is very tired and would benefit from being rested from the next match.

The board strongly advise you to buy a %s as an injury in this position could cause real problems.

column3: %s (%s) is correctly given a red card, that was a bad challenge.
%s (%s) has been sent off for a very rash challenge.
%s (%s) is sent walking back to the dressing room by the ref. He had to after that reckless challenge.
The ref shows a red card to %s (%s). That could be for the challenge or the dissent that followed!
The ref reaches into his pocket for his red card. %s (%s) has been sent off.
Another late challenge by %s (%s) - the ref has no choice but to send him off.
Oh no! Goal for %s, %s put into his own net!
That's a goal for %s, unlucky %s redirected it into his own net!
GOAL to %s, %s unluckily hit into his own net!
GOAL to %s, %s scoring a stunning goal unfortunately at the wrong end!
GOAL for %s, %s with a terrible back pass to his keeper.
OWN GOAL - great for %s but unlucky for %s!
%s score what an awesome strike by %s!
%s score thanks to brilliant work by %s!
GOAL to %s. That was a brilliant finish by %s.
GOAL to %s. %s did really well there.
GOAL to %s. %s will be pleased with that!
%s score thanks to a wonderful free-kick by %s!
%s score! What an excellent free-kick by %s!
GOAL to %s. Brilliantly taken curling free-kick by %s.
GOAL to %s. %s curled that around the keeper wonderfully!
GOAL to %s. An excellent free-kick from distance by %s.
GOAL to %s! That was a wonderful free-kick by %s!
A fantastic goal by %s (%s) but it won't stand. An infringement was spotted by the linesman.
Wonderful GOAL by %s (%s), but it has been disallowed by the ref!
GOAL! A brilliant finish by %s (%s) - but it won't count! The ref must have spotted an infringement!
GOAL to %s (%s)! Or is it? No goal! It's been disallowed for some reason!
%s (%s) is celebrating a GOAL but the referee isn't allowing it to stand!
That's a yellow card for %s (%s) - he went in late!
%s (%s) thought that was a goal but it has been disallowed for offside! Good spot linesman!
A great attempt by %s (%s) unfortunately for him the goalkeeper was able to match it!
%s (%s) puts in a great shot but the keeper was able to keep it out.
Good effort by %s (%s) but the keeper was prepared.
An awesome shot by %s (%s) but the keeper had it covered.
Fantastic effort by %s (%s). The keeper made a great save though.
That was a brilliant attempt by %s (%s). The keeper did really well to keep that out.
%s limps off the pitch, %s bring %s on to replace him.
%s is going off injured, %s are now down to %d men.
%s (%s) isn't looking he can continue much longer.
%s (%s) has been booked for dangerous play. There didn't look to be too much wrong with that though.
%s (%s) seems badly injured, his manager is going to have to take him off.
%s (%s) is injured. Surely he must be replaced.
%s has picked up a bad knock. %s are going to have to make a change.
%s isn't going to be able to continue with that injury. %s are going to have to make a substitution.
%s (%s) is going to have to come off. He looks in agony.
%s (%s) looks like he's picked up a painful injury. He's trying to struggle on though.
%s (%s) is trying to run off that knock.
%s (%s) has picked up an injury. It seems that he is going to try and play on though.
%s (%s) seems to be limping a bit after that last challenge.
%s (%s) is hobbling a bit after that last tackle!
%s's (%s) name is going in the book for that rash challenge.
%s (%s) looks like he's picked up an injury. At the moment he seems to be trying to continue though.
%s are making a replacement. %s is coming on for %s.
%s are changing things around. %s is coming on for %s.
It looks like %s have decided to make a change. %s is replacing %s.
%s are making a switch, %s is replacing %s.
%s are making a change. %s is going to replace %s.
%s are making a change, %s is coming on, and %s is taking an early bath.
%s (%s) has finally been booked for his persistent fouling.
The referee has decided to book %s (%s) for dissent.
That was a bad challenge by %s (%s) and he has rightly been booked for it.
%s (%s) has been sent packing by the ref, that's his second bookable offence.
That's a second yellow for %s (%s) and he's already walking towards the dressing room.
GOAL to %s, %s was unlucky to deflect that effort into his own goal!
What a brilliant move by %s, finished off beautifully by %s.
%s score thanks to a deflection of %s's shot by a defender.
GOAL! %s will be pleased %s managed to keep his cool to slot that home past the keeper!
GOAL to %s. %s remained calm and finished it well.
GOAL! %s's %s turns and strikes the ball home brilliantly.
GOAL! %s's %s cheekily lobs the ball over the keeper - what a great goal!
%s have scored! %s hit that sweetly into the top corner.
%s (%s) has gone into the book for that silly behaviour!
GOAL to %s! What a thunderous strike by %s!
%s have scored! %s was in the right place at the right time!
GOAL to %s! %s rose above the defenders to head that in!
GOAL to %s. %s placed that brilliantly with his head!
GOAL to %s. %s thought he'd missed but the ball somehow found its way into the net!
%s celebrate that GOAL - %s with a perfectly taken free-kick!
%s were celebrating %s putting the ball in the net, but it's been disallowed for offside!
GOAL to %s (%s), but the linesman is flagging! The goal won't count!
What great reactions by the keeper to save the effort by %s (%s).
Brilliant block by the keeper as %s (%s) looked to have scored!
A late challenge by %s (%s), he can't be surprised to receive a booking for that!
The keeper dives at %s's (%s) feet to retrieve the ball, what great keeping!
The keeper manages to save %s's (%s) effort.
%s (%s) can't believe it as it is just cleared off the line!
%s (%s) places the ball past the keeper but it's cleared off the line. Great defending!
%s's (%s) shot almost finds the net but is kept out thanks to some brilliant defending!
%s (%s) has his effort cleared, he'll be disappointed as the keeper was stranded in no man's land.
The keeper was beaten by %s's (%s) shot but the ball rebounded off the crossbar to safety!
%s (%s) can't believe his luck as the ball hits the post!
A great effort by %s (%s) but it hits the post!
A great attempt by %s (%s) that was only just off target.
%s (%s)'s shot had the keeper scrambling as it just sailed past the post.
%s (%s) looks disappointed as he puts his shot slightly wide.
A wonderful attempt by %s (%s) that should have been a goal.
%s (%s) will be disappointed he couldn't hit the target from there.
%s (%s) should have done better with that attempt!
%s (%s) should have at least made the keeper work on that attempt!
%s (%s) would be expected to hit the target from there.
%s (%s) will be in trouble with his manager for not hitting the target.
%s (%s) puts his effort into row Z!

column3: Changes made in Edit Mode will only be seen in new games. The existing saved game will not be affected. Do you wish to continue?

column3: If you return to the main menu, you will lose any unsaved progress you have made. Are you sure you wish to continue?
